1.t: God has made devoid of all virtue the deeds of those who have disbelieved and prevented others from the way of God.
1.tr: Allazeena kafaroo Wa-saddoo 'an sabeelil laahi adalla a'maalahum

2.t: God forgives the sins and reforms the hearts of the righteously striving believers who have faith in what is revealed to Muhammad - which is the Truth from his Lord.
2.tr: Wallazeena aamanoo Wa-'amilus saalihaati Wa-aamanoo bimaa nuzzila 'alaa Muhammadinw-wa huwal haqqu mir Rabbihim kaffara 'anhum saiyiaatihim Wa-aslaha baalahum

3.t: This is because the disbelievers have followed falsehood and the believers have followed the Truth from their Lord. Thus God explains to the human being their own prospects.
3.tr: Zaalika bi-annal lazeena kafarut taba'ul baatila Wa-annal lazeena aamanut taba'ul haqqa mir Rabbihim; kazaalika yadribul laahu linnaasi amsaalahum

4.t: If you encounter the disbelievers in a battle, strike-off their heads. Take them as captives when they are defeated. Then you may set them free as a favor to them, with or without a ransom, when the battle is over. This is the Law. Had God wanted, He could have granted them (unbelievers) victory, but He wants to test you through each other. The deeds of those who are killed for the cause of God will never be without virtuous results.
4.tr: Fa-izaa laqeetumul lazeena kafaroo fadarbar riqaabi, hattaaa izaa askhan-tumoohum fashuddul wasaaqa, fa-immaa mannnam ba'du Wa-immaa fidaaa'an hattaa tada'al harbu awzaarahaa; zaalika Wa-law yashaaa'ul laahu lantasara minhum Wa-laakin li-yabluwa ba'dakum bi-ba'd; wallazeena qutiloo fee sabeelil laahi falaien yudilla a'maalahum

5.t: God will lead them to everlasting happiness and improve their condition.

6.t: He will admit them into the Paradise which He has made known to them.

7.t: Believers, if you help God, He will help you and make you steadfast (in your faith).
7.tr: Yaaa-ayyuhal lazeena aamanooo in tansurul laaha yansurkum Wa-yusabbit aqdaamakum

8.t: The fate of the disbelievers will be to stumble and their deeds will have no virtuous results;
8.tr: Wallazeena kafaroo fata'-sal lahum Wa-adalla a'maalahum

9.t: they have hated God's revelation, and thus, He has made their deeds devoid of all virtue.
9.tr: Zaalika bi-annahum karihoo maaa anzal allaahu fa-ahbata a'maalahum

10.t: Have they not travelled through the land and seen the terrible end of those who lived before them? God brought upon them utter destruction and the disbelievers will also faced similar perdition.
10.tr: Afalam yaseeroo fil ardi fayanzuroo kaifa kaana 'aaqibatul lazeena min qablihim; dammaral laahu 'alaihim Wa-lilkaafireena amsaaluhaa

11.t: God is the guardian of the believers, but the disbelievers have no guardian.
11.tr: Zaalika bi-annal laaha mawlal lazeena aamanoo Wa-annal kaafireena laa mawlaa lahum

12.t: God will admit the righteously striving believers into the gardens wherein streams flow. However, the disbelievers who enjoyed themselves and ate like cattle will have for their dwelling hell fire.
12.tr: Innal-laaha yudkhilul lazeena aamanoo Wa-'amilus saalihaati Jannaatin tajree min tahtihal anhaaru wallazeena kafaroo yatamatta'oona Wa-ya'kuloona kamaa ta'kulul an'aamu wan Naaru maswan lahum

13.t: (Muhammad), how many towns, much more powerful than the one from which you have been expelled, have We destroyed and left helpless?
13.tr: Wa-ka-ayyim min qaryatin hiya ashaddu quwwatam min qaryatikal lateee akhrajatka ahlaknaahum falaa naasira lahum

14.t: Can the one who follows the authority of his Lord be considered equal to the one whose evil deeds are made to seem attractive to him and who follows his own desires?
14.tr: Afaman kaana 'alaa baiyinatim mir Rabbihee kaman zuyyina lahoo sooo'u 'amalihee wattaba'ooo ahwaaa'ahum

15.t: The garden, which is promised to the pious, is like one in which there are streams of unpolluted water, streams of milk of unchangeable taste, streams of delicious wine, and streams of crystal clear honey. Therein they will have all kinds of fruits and forgiveness from their Lord. On the other hand (can these people be considered like), those who will live forever in hell fire and will drink boiling water which will rip their intestines to bits?
15.tr: Masalul jannatil latee wu'idal muttaqoona feehaaa anhaarum min maaa'in ghayri aasininw Wa-anhaarum mil labanil lam yataghaiyar ta'muhoo Wa-anhaarum min khamril lazzatin li-shaaribeena Wa-anhaarum min 'asalim musaffanw Wa-lahum feeha min kullis samaraati Wa-maghfiratum mir Rabbihim kaman huwa khaalidun fin naari Wa-suqoo maaa'an hameeman faqatta'a am'aaa'ahum

16.t: (Muhammad), some of them listen to you, but when they leave you they ask those who have received knowledge, "What did he say a few moments ago?" God has sealed the hearts of such people who have followed their worldly desires.
16.tr: Wa-minhum maien yastami'u ilaika hattaaa izaa kharajoo min 'indika qaaloo lil-lazeena ootul 'ilma maazaa qaala aanifaa; ulaaa'ikal lazeena taba'al laahu 'alaa quloobihim wattaba'ooo ahwaaa'ahum

17.t: God will increase the guidance and piety of those who seek guidance.
17.tr: Wallazeenah tadaw zaadahum hudanw Wa-aataahum taqwaahum

18.t: Are they waiting for the Hour of Doom to suddenly approach them? Its signs have already appeared. How will they then come to their senses when the Hour itself will approach them?
18.tr: Fahal yanzuroona illas Saa'ata an ta'tiyahum baghtatan faqad jaaa'a ashraatuhaa; fa-annaa lahum izaa jaaa'at-hum zikraahum

19.t: Know that God is the only Lord. Ask forgiveness for your sins and for the sins of the believing men and women. God knows when you move and when you rest.
19.tr: Fa'lam annahoo laaa ilaaha illal laahu wastaghfir lizambika Wa-lilmu'mineena walmu'minaat; wallaahu ya'lamu mutaqallabakum Wa-maswaakum

20.t: The believers say, "Why is a chapter about jihad - fighting for the cause of God - not revealed?" But when such a chapter, with clear commands and a mention of jihad is revealed, you will see those whose hearts are sick look at you as if suffering the agony of death. One can expect nothing better from them!
20.tr: Wa-yaqoolul lazeena aamanoo law-laa nuzzilat Sooratun fa-izaaa unzilat Sooratum Muhkamatunw Wa-zukira feehal qitaalu ra-aytal lazeena fee quloobihim maraduien yanzuroona ilaika nazaral maghshiyyi 'alaihi minal mawti fa'awlaa lahum

21.t: Since they have (pledged) Us obedience and to speak reasonably, it would be more proper for them, when it is decided (that everyone must take part in the battle), to remain true (in their pledge to God).
21.tr: Taa'atunw Wa-qawlum ma'roof; fa-izaa 'azamal amru falaw sadaqul laaha lakaana khairal lahum

22.t: If you ignore the commands of God would you then also spread evil in the land and sever the ties of kinship?
22.tr: Fahal 'asaitum in tawallaitum an tufsidoo fil ardi Wa-tuqatti'ooo arhaamakum

23.t: God has condemned these people and made them deaf, dumb, and blind.
23.tr: Ulaaa'ikal lazeena la'anahumul laahu fa-asammahum Wa-a'maaa absaarahum

24.t: Is it that they do not think about the Quran or are their hearts sealed?
24.tr: Afalaa yatadabbaroonal Qur-aana am 'alaa quloobin aqfaaluhaa

25.t: Those who have reverted to disbelief after guidance has become manifest to them, have been seduced and given false hopes by satan.
25.tr: Innal lazeenar taddoo 'alaaa adbaarihim min ba'di maa tabaiyana lahumul hudash Shaitaanu sawwala lahum Wa-amlaa lahum

26.t: This is because they have said to those who hate God's revelation, "We shall obey you in some matters." But God knows all their secrets.
26.tr: Zaalika bi-annahum qaaloo lillazeena karihoo maa nazzalal laahu sanutee'ukum fee ba'dil amri wallaahu ya'lamu israarahum

27.t: How terrible it will be for them when the angels take away their souls by striking their faces and their backs.
27.tr: Fakaifa izaa tawaffat-humul malaaa'ikatu yadriboona wujoohahum Wa-adbaa-rahum

28.t: for their following that which had incurred God's anger, and their hatred to please God. Thus, God has made their deeds devoid of all virtue.
28.tr: Zaalika bi-annahumut taba'oo maaa askhatal laaha Wa-karihoo ridwaanahoo fa-ahbata a'maalahum

29.t: Do those whose hearts are sick think that God will never make their malice public?
29.tr: Am hasibal lazeena fee quloobihim maradun al laien yukhrijal laahu adghaanahum

30.t: Had We wanted, We could have made you recognize their faces. You will certainly recognize them by the tone of their speech. God knows all your deeds.
30.tr: Wa-law nashaaa'u la-arainaakahum fala-'araftahum bi-seemaahum; Wa-lata'rifan-nahum fee lahnil qawl; wallaahu ya'lamu a'maalakum

31.t: We shall certainly test you until We know those who strive hard for the cause of God and those who exercise patience. We will also examine your deeds.
31.tr: Wa-lanabluwannakum hattaa na'lamal mujaahideena minkum wassaabireena Wa-nabluwa akhbaarakum

32.t: The disbelievers who prevent others from the way of God and give the Messengers a hard time - even after the guidance has been made clear to them - will never be able to cause any harm to God, and He will turn their deeds devoid of all virtue.
32.tr: Innal lazeena kafaroo Wa-saddoo 'an sabeelil laahi Wa-shaaaqqur Rasoola min ba'di maa tabaiyana lahumul hudaa laien yadurrul laaha shai'anw Wa-sa-yuhbitu a'maalahum

33.t: Believers, obey God and the Messenger and do not invalidate your deeds.
33.tr: Yaaa-ayyuhal lazeena aamanoo atee'ul laaha Wa-atee'ur Rasoola Wa-laa tubtilooo a'maalakum

34.t: God will never forgive the disbelievers who prevent others from the way of God and who die as disbelievers.
34.tr: Innal lazeena kafaroo Wa-saddoo 'an sabeelil laahi summa maatoo Wa-hum kuffaarun falaien yaghfiral laahu lahum

35.t: Do not be weak hearted and do not appeal for an (unjust) settlement; you have the upper hand. God is with you and He will never reduce the reward for your deeds.
35.tr: Falaa tahinoo Wa-tad'ooo ilas salmi Wa-antumul a'lawna wallaahu ma'akum Wa-lany yatirakum a'maalakum

36.t: The worldly life is only a childish game. If you have faith and piety, you will receive your rewards and God will not ask you to pay for them.
36.tr: Innamal hayaatud dunyaa la'ibunw Wa-lahw; Wa-in tu'minoo Wa-tattaqoo yu'tikum ujoorakum Wa-laa yas'alkum amwaalakum

37.t: Should He ask for your possessions you would be niggardly as it would be hard for you to give. Thus, He would make your malice become public.
37.tr: Ien yas'alkumoohaa fa-yuhfikum tabkhaloo Wa-yukhrij adghaanakum

38.t: It is you who are asked to spend for the cause of God, but some of you behave in a niggardly way. Whoever behaves miserly does so against his own soul. God is Self-sufficient and you are poor. If you were to turn away from Him, He would just replace you with another people, who will not be like you.
38.tr: Haaa antum haaa'ulaaa'i tud'awna litunfiqoo fee sabeelillaahi faminkum many yabkhalu Wa-many yabkhal fa-innamaa yabkhalu 'an nafsih; wallaahu Ghaniyyu Wa-antumul fuqaraaa'; Wa-in tatawallaw yastabdil qawman ghairakum summa laa yakoonooo amsaalakum
